intro: Pedicularis recurva, commonly known as the zigzag lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its zigzagging stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
